intro: Cleome spinosa f. pungens, commonly known as the spiked cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and profuse display of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. The f. pungens form is distinguished by its more pronounced spines and compact growth compared to the typical form.
